introduction: Muscha and Trini Trimpop are two of the most important protagonists of German punk and underground films. Childhood friends, both brought up in the punk scene of Düsseldorf. They wrote and directed the new wave avant garde film "Humanes Töten" in 1980. Muscha moved to Berlin, made friends with the world famous group Einstürzende Neubauten and the film producer/writer Klaus Maeck. This resulted in his second feature film, the cult classic "Decoder" (1984). Trini Trimpop produced it and wrote the script. Blietzkrieg Bop is their first short film.
